message: White privilege is being able to walk down the street at night and not having to worry about being shot by a cop. It is simply the """"radical"""" idea that society favors white people over people of color, and it is completely prevalent in every aspect of life. Having privilege does not mean that you don't struggle or work hard. It has nothing to do with that. It just means that you have an advantage in everyday life because of the color of your skin. This page is full of people who are mainly white and who do not recognize their own privilege. And white privilege is different than other types of privilege in that it is systematic. In society, there will always be the underpinnings of racism in everything that happensm from who the hall monitor decides to stop and check for a pass at a high school to how police officers restrain people differently based on their race. I am not saying that white people get what they have for free, and that is not what white privilege is. White privilege is knowing that when you wake up the next day, society will treat you with the respect that you deserve, the respect that strangely disappears when society interacts with a person of color. Don't be fucking ignorant.

Dear Rep Brooks - sorry there are so many small-minded people in this world, but of course, this is nothing new. Even though I'm a republican and will likely have to vote for Trump (unfortunately), I believe you are very correct in your statements about Trump. Your balanced and fair opinion can only be attacked by those who are on the fringe and incapable of adult discourse. I sure wish the GOP could have come up with something better. Trump's support (even mine to a degree, even though I now have no choice) is an incredibly clear sign of just how frustrated everyone is with """"Washington"""". Fix that, and we'll never have to deal with, or have our party, represented by someone like Trump ever again. Don't fix it, and the GOP (at least as we know it today, or better, knew it back when) may cease to exist. Good luck. Hang in there.
